title: Linked List Cycle
description:
Given the head of a linked list, determine if the linked list has a cycle in it. A cycle exists if some node in the list can be reached again by continuously following the next_node pointer.

Return true if there is a cycle, false otherwise.

Constraints:
- The number of nodes in the list is in the range [0, 10000]
- -100000 <= Node.val <= 100000
test_code:
require 'minitest/autorun'
require_relative 'solution'

class TestLinkedListCycle < Minitest::Test
  def test_has_cycle
    n1 = ListNode.new(3)
    n2 = ListNode.new(2)
    n3 = ListNode.new(0)
    n4 = ListNode.new(-4)
    n1.next_node = n2
    n2.next_node = n3
    n3.next_node = n4
    n4.next_node = n2
    assert_equal true, has_cycle(n1)
  end
  def test_no_cycle
    n1 = ListNode.new(1)
    n2 = ListNode.new(2)
    n3 = ListNode.new(3)
    n1.next_node = n2
    n2.next_node = n3
    assert_equal false, has_cycle(n1)
  end
  def test_single_node
    n1 = ListNode.new(1)
    assert_equal false, has_cycle(n1)
  end
  def test_empty
    assert_equal false, has_cycle(nil)
  end
end
